summary: This document outlines revised policies and procedures for suicide prevention, inmate placement, and observation at a correctional facility, likely MCC-NY, following an incident or review. It details protocols for single cell placement, suicide watch, documentation, staff training, and management of high-risk inmates, including those with sex offense histories.

persons.name: Chief Psychologist
persons.context: Oversees psychology staff, documentation accuracy, training, and provides input on inmate management, particularly for sex offenders and suicide risk.

persons.name: Warden
persons.context: Notified of suicide watch placements, determines housing for suicidal inmates, and involved in staffing decisions like re-establishing the Drug Abuse Coordinator position.

persons.name: Drug Abuse Coordinator
persons.context: Position is shared; the Warden is working to make it full-time. The coordinator counseled a Drug Treatment Specialist about documentation errors.

persons.name: Drug Treatment Specialist
persons.context: Was counseled by the Chief Psychologist and Drug Abuse Coordinator for incorrectly documenting in a suicide watch log book, though with no ill intent.

persons.name: Associate Warden, Programs
persons.context: Notified if there are inconsistencies in the SENTRY roster for inmates on suicide watch in the hospital area.

persons.name: Captain
persons.context: Discusses inmate needs with executive staff and psychology, and will be notified to enforce accountability if suicide watch rounds are not conducted properly.

persons.name: Staff Attorney
persons.context: Assists when an inmate's attorney or court expresses concerns about the inmate.

persons.name: Staff Psychologist
persons.context: A second Staff Psychologist has been added to help reduce workload and allow more time for documentation review.

persons.name: SHU Lieutenant
persons.context: Examines sign-in sheets for SHU Suicide Prevention training for accuracy.

persons.name: Lieutenant
persons.context: Notified when inmates are removed from suicide watch, required to sign suicide watch log books each shift, and part of the authorization chain for legal visits for inmates on suicide watch.

persons.name: Institution Duty Officer
persons.context: Completes a single cell report during each shift.

persons.name: Unit 2 Officer
persons.context: Signs suicide watch log books hourly when doing rounds in the suicide watch area.

persons.name: Unit Officer
persons.context: Rounds the suicide watch area hourly and signs the suicide watch log books.

connections.description: The Chief Psychologist, along with the Drug Abuse Coordinator, counseled the DTS concerning documentation errors in the suicide watch log book.
They jointly counseled the Drug Treatment Specialist and work within the same Psychology Department.
They collaborate on decisions regarding suicide watch housing and discuss inmate needs in executive staff meetings.
The Warden is working to re-establish the Drug Abuse Coordinator position as a full-time role.
They discuss inmate needs during staff meetings and the Captain is to be notified by psychology if suicide watch rounds are not conducted.
The Chief Psychologist's department notifies the Associate Warden of inconsistencies in the SENTRY roster for suicide watch inmates.

keyFacts: The facility has implemented a strict system to prevent single-celling, especially for inmates at risk of suicide, requiring psychology to recommend cellmates and notify multiple staff levels.
Psychology Observation has been eliminated at MCC-NY to avoid confusion, and all inmates on Suicide Watch require specific authorization for legal visits, with continuous staff observation.
Documentation procedures have been tightened: only the staff member directly observing a suicide watch inmate may document in the log book, which is now monitored daily by the Chief Psychologist.
High-profile cases and inmates with a history or charge of a sex offense will have PSY ALERT codes applied more immediately and frequently.
The Warden is working to re-establish the Drug Abuse Coordinator as a full-time position to provide an additional supervisory psychologist for critical clinical services.
